description: Ministry of Social Development - Expansion of Micro Finance Service to the Needy Citizens in the Kingdom of Bahrain

subproject.corporate outcome: Capacities of national and local institutions enhanced to scale up proven MDG acceleration interventions and to plan, monitor, report and evaluate the MDG progress in the context of related national development priorities
subproject.description:
The Project focuses on developing microfinance capacity of local NGOs by adopting a more pro-growth oriented microfinance approach, employment generation modality by promoting micro entrepreneurship targeting a larger proportion of the loans provided towards unemployed youth and women. The Project will concentrate on building capacities of local NGOs to operate as microstart service providers.  Support will also be provided in the development of microstart policies encompassing various stakeholders.  

Due to the establishment of the Family Bank, seed funds instead of grants will be provided to NGOs. The three parties to the Project Document (UNDP, Ahli United Bank, and the Ministry of Social Development) have, therefore, agreed to revise the budget and some objectives of this agreement.  The Ministry of Social Development and UNDP will continue to be partners in this project. Ahli United Bank has agreed to cease its engagement in this project and no more funds is expected from AUB, and therefore no grants will be provided to NGOs for onward disbursement as loans. MoSD and UNDP, however, will provide seed funds to NGOs to establish their Microfinance system and develop their capacities.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Micro Finance
